intro: Holzneria, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Holzneria thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
